column4: Hey all, can I ask a bit of a noobish question about unstable packages here?
That's why it's a noobish question. I have no idea how to use unstable packages, but I want to just get the latest Blender and Ogre from my package manager
Not the versions about half a year old
Can you people help me set that up?
True, true. But it's a matter of comfort. Besides, it'd be nice if my blender was automatically kept up to date too
True, true. I already have a version installed manually. The thing is, there must be a better way, right?
Linux users always tell me it's much more user-friendly and simply better in almost every way than Windows
Ah, ppa is shorthand for a repository of sorts?
I've found something that looks like a ppa. "ppa:cheleb/blender-svn". Now... indulge the noob: what do I do with this? :P
sudo apt-add ppa:cheleb/blender-svn I belive, if I remember the syntax correctly, alternatively you can add it as a repository through synaptic or manualy put it into /etc/apt/sources.list
I can't find apt-add, by the way..
there is a way but not with vanilla Ubuntu kernel. you'll either need to recompile the kernel or use server kernel which has that support built-in (at least it should have)
Would you recommend I copypasta some stuff into a terminal and upgrade, or  just reinstall to 64 bit?
